com.qtplaf.library.database

Class Field

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qtplaf.library.database.Field
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FieldDataFilter, FieldDataInstr, FieldDataValue, FieldIndex, FieldInstrumentDesc, FieldInstrumentId, FieldInstrumentPipScale, FieldInstrumentPipValue, FieldInstrumentPrimaryCurrency, FieldInstrumentSecondaryCurrency, FieldInstrumentTickScale, FieldInstrumentTickValue, FieldInstrumentVolumeScale, FieldOfferSide, FieldPatternFamily, FieldPatternId, FieldPeriod, FieldPeriodId, FieldPeriodName, FieldPeriodSize, FieldPeriodUnitIndex, FieldServerId, FieldServerName, FieldServerTitle, FieldStatisticsId, FieldStatisticsTitle, FieldTableName, FieldTime, FieldTimeFmt, FieldVolume

    public class Field
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>
    A Field packs the necessary information to define a data item, mainly in the form of tabular data.
    Author:
    Miquel Sas

        Returns a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this value is less than, equal to, or greater than the specified value.

        A field is considered to be equal to another field if the alias, type, length and decimals are the same.

        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>
        Parameters:
        o - The object to compare.
        Returns:
        The comparison integer.

      • isLookup

        public boolean isLookup()
        Check if this field is a lookup field. In a lookup, primary key fields are shown by default, then the key description field if it exists, and finally any field tagged as lookup.
        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • setLookup
